intro: Eumachia obovoidea subsp. villosistipula, commonly known as the hairy-stipule eumachia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its elliptic to ovate leaves with a hairy texture on the stipules. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, with white to pale pink petals. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
